children.name: 4-PS3-1
children.description: Use evidence to construct an explanation relating the speed of an object to the energy of that object.

children.name: 4-PS3-2
children.description: Make observations to provide evidence that energy can be transferred from place to place by sound, light, heat, and electric currents.

children.name: 4-PS3-3
children.description: Ask questions and predict outcomes about the changes in energy that occur when objects collide.

children.name: Energy in Chemical Processes & Everyday Life
4-PS3-4
children.description: Apply scientific ideas to design, test, and refine a device that converts energy from one form to another.

children.name: 4-PS4-1
children.description: Develop a model of waves to describe patterns in terms of amplitude and wavelength and that waves can cause objects to move.

children.name: 4-PS4-2
children.description: Develop a model to describe that light reflecting from objects and entering the eye allows objects to be seen.

children.name: 4-PS4-3
children.description: Generate and compare multiple solutions that use patterns to transfer information.

children.name: 4-LS1-1
children.description: Construct an argument that plants and animals have internal and external structures that function to support survival, growth, behavior, and reproduction.

children.name: 4-LS1-2
children.description: Use a model to describe that animals receive different types of information through their senses, process the information in their brain, and respond to the information in different ways.

children.name: 4-ESS1-1
children.description: Identify evidence from patterns in rock formations and fossils in rock layers for changes in a landscape over time to support an explanation for changes in a landscape over time.

children.name: 4-ESS2-1
children.description: Make observations and/or measurements to provide evidence of the effects of weathering or the rate of erosion by water, ice, wind, or vegetation.

children.name: 4-ESS2-2
children.description: Analyze and interpret data from maps to describe patterns of Earth’s features.

children.name: 4-ESS3-1
children.description: Obtain and combine information to describe that energy and fuels are derived from natural resources and their uses affect the environment.
